title: What comes first to mind, words or ideas? - Quora

response.answer_text: 4–5 months old babies hardly know any vocabulary, but lack of vocabulary doesn't stop them from thinking or imagining. For example, when you show a flashlight to a baby, he/she will still try to hold it, observe it. They get lost into their own world of imagination and curiosity and thus, many ideas are created in their minds. They like to observe everything and everyone around them, and different ideas come to their mind.  Primitive humans used sounds only for gestures.They didn't have any vocabulary or language, but it doesn't mean, ideas didn't use to come to their minds. They had ideas, that's why, they made weapons using stones and they were able to discover fire. Therefore, Idea comes first. Idea and to express the idea we put it in words. Words are for expressing or conveying to someone else. And idea come in oneself it is not necessary to have words. Many times we know, we can feel but not express it in words.
